what: Starting Echoview and loading raw data
title: Broadband SIngle Targets
text: preparation stage, Echoview started, empty EV file created data loaded: Echoview started, folder containing raw data can located contained raw files listed (excluding raw.evi files): Next create new EV File load raw data: Raw files can cleared EV File, takes name EVFile name fileset containing raw files (default Fileset1): New raw data can easily added EVAddRawData:
code: #Loading the EchoviewR library library(EchoviewR)  #Starting Echoview echoview = StartEchoview() rawDir <- "D:\\Multikrill\\Raw\\"  raw <- list.files(path=rawDir,pattern=".raw")[-which(list.files(path=rawDir,pattern=".raw")%in%list.files(path=rawDir,pattern=".raw.evi"))] #Create a new EV File EVFile <- EVCreateNew(EVAppObj=echoview, dataFiles = paste0(rawDir,raw[1:3])) #Note that the EVCreateNew coomand returns a list of two elements, where the first one is the actual EVFile Object, therefore, we rename this object to EVFile: EVFile <- EVFile$EVFile EVClearRawData(EVFile=EVFile, fileset="Fileset1") EVAddRawData(EVFile=EVFile, fileset="Fileset1", dataFiles=paste0(rawDir,raw[1:3]))

title: Broadband SIngle Targets
text: EchoviewR creating connection Echoview COM scripting. COM scripting, everything treaten object. Echoview becomes object, EV file becomes object inside Echoview object, variables become objects inside EV file object inside Echoview object forth. Therefore want change properties variable first need select right variable object. EchoviewR number built-function find: Variables - EVAcoVarNameFinder(EVFile, acoVarName) filesets - EVFindFilesetByName(EVFile, filesetName) lines - EVFindLineByName(EVFile, lineName) Regions - EVFindRegionByName(EVFile, regionName) different functions needs EVFile object (created previously EVCreateNew) character string name variable, fileset, line region selected. can example look variable called Fileset 1: TS pulse compressed wideband pings T1, going use base single target detection : object found successfully, announced message, error shown. Errors likely linked spelling mistakes variable name wrong EVFile name provided.
code: EVVar <- EVAcoVarNameFinder(EVFile, acoVarName="Fileset 1: TS pulse compressed wideband pings T1") EVVar <- EVVar$EVVar

title: Broadband SIngle Targets
text: Lines often important parts analysis acoustic data, example exclude near surface bottom area.
code: # Create Surface Line at 1.2 m surface <- EVNewFixedDepthLine(EVFile = EVFile, depth=1.2,"surface") #Create bottom line at 2.3 m b23 <- EVNewFixedDepthLine(EVFile = EVFile, depth=2.3,"bottom23")

title: Broadband SIngle Targets
text: Detect bottom custom settings, minimal example, EVFile EVVar need provided:
code: bottom = EVBottomDetection(EVFile=EVFile, EVVar=EVVar, LineName="Bottom",                            algorithm=2, #Use best bottom candidate                            StartDepth = 5,                            StopDepth = 100,                            MinSv = -60,                            UseBackstep = "True",                            DiscriminationLevel =-50.0,                            BackstepRange = -0.50,                            PeakThreshold = -50.0,                            MaxDropouts = 2,                            WindowRadius = 8,                            MinPeakAssymmetry = -1.0,                            replaceOldBottom = FALSE)

title: Broadband SIngle Targets
text: Lines can also created offset previously detected line:
code: bottomoffset05 <- EVCreateEditableLine(EVFile, "bottom", "bottomoffset05", Multiply=1,Add=-0.5,SpanGaps=TRUE)

text: moment writing, EchoviewR dependencies: (sp)[https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/sp/index.html] - Adding spatial functionality package (geosphere)[https://cran.r-project.org/package=geosphere] - improved distance calculations (devtools)[https://cran.r-project.org/package=devtools] - install packages GitHub (maptools)[https://cran.r-project.org/package=maptools] - spatial funcitonality (RDCOMClient)[https://github.com/omegahat/RDCOMClient] - Enable COM communication R (lubridate)[https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/lubridate/vignettes/lubridate.html] - Improved date manipulations Packages sp, geosphere, maptools lubridate can directly installed CRAN. use simple function check packages installed loaded. case, packages installed loaded: RDCOMClient installed GitHub, via Omegahat: dependencies satisfied EchoviewR can installed:
code: #Make sure package is installed and loaded packagecheck <- function(package){   if(!package %in% installed.packages()){install.packages(package, dependencies=TRUE)}   require(package,character.only = TRUE) }  #Now we can check if the packages are isntalled packagelist <- c('sp','geosphere','maptools','lubridate','devtools') apply(as.matrix(packagelist),1,function(x)packagecheck(x)) devtools::install_github("omegahat/RDCOMClient") require(RDCOMClient) devtools::install_github('AustralianAntarcticDivision/EchoviewR') require(EchoviewR)

title: Getting started with EchoviewR
text: Generally first step either create new empty file, create new file based template, open existing EV File: Create new empty EV file Create new EV file based template order create new EV file based template, tell EchoviewR within Echoview application object (EVApp) want create new EV file template located local machine (templatefn=TemplateFilename)
code: #First start Echoview EVApp <- StartEchoview()  #Create a new empty file inside our Echoview object EVApp EVFile <- EVNewFile(EVApp)$EVFile  #Close the file EVCloseFile(EVFile)  #Quit Echoview  QuitEchoview(EVApp) # 1) Start Echoview # 2) Create a new file based on a template (TemplateFilename) # 3) Save the EV file as OutputFilenam # 4) Close the file # 5) Quit Echoview  #Set the tempalte filename TemplateFilename = "temp.EV" #Set the output filename OutputFilename = "NewFile.EV"  #Start Echoview EVApp <- StartEchoview()  #Create a new file based on the template TemplateFilename EVFile <- EVNewFile(EVApp, templateFn = TemplateFilename)$EVFile  #Save the file under a new name EVSaveAsFile(EVFile = EVFile, fileName = OutputFilename)  #Close the file EVCloseFile(EVFile)  #Quit Echoview  QuitEchoview(EVApp)

title: Getting started with EchoviewR
code: EVFILENAME = "TestEv.EV"  #Start Echoview EVApp <- StartEchoview()  #Open the EV File EVOpenFile(EVAppObj = EVApp, fileName = EVFILENAME)  #Save the file EVSaveFile(EVFile = EVFile)  #Close the file EVCloseFile(EVFile)  #Quit Echoview  QuitEchoview(EVApp)

code: EVSchoolsDetect(EVFile = EVFile,                acoVarName='70 kHz Speed > 2.5',                outputRegionClassName = 'agg',                deleteExistingRegions = TRUE,                distanceMode = "GPS distance",                maximumHorizontalLink = 10, #m                maximumVerticalLink = 2,#m                minimumCandidateHeight = 1, #m                minimumCandidateLength = 3, #m                minimumSchoolHeight = 1, #m                minimumSchoolLength = 3, #m                dataThreshold = -70) #Export Aggregation information EVIntegrationByRegionsExport(EVFile = EVFile, acoVarName = "Aggregation mask",                               regionClassName='agg',                              exportFn=paste0(evex,basename(rawdirs[1]),'_AGG.csv'),                              dataThreshold =-80)  #Export Aggregations @ a resolution of 200 m x 5 m  #Change grid EVChangeVariableGrid(EVFile=EVFile,                       acoVarName = "Aggregation mask",                       timeDistanceGridType=5,                      timeDistanceGridDistance = 200,                      depthGridType=1,                      depthGridDistance = 5) #Export  EVExportIntegrationByCells(EVFile=EVFile, variableName='Aggregation mask',                               filePath=paste0(evex, basename(rawdirs[1]),'_INT.csv')) #export seabed EVExportLineAsCSV(EVFile=EVFile, acoVarName='Aggregation mask',                     lineName='Surface Exclusion Threshold',                     filePath=paste0(evex,basename(rawdirs[1]),'_seabed.csv',sep=''))    #export gps EVExportUnderlying(EVFile=EVFile, variableName='070: position GPS fixes',                       pingRange = c(-1, -1),                       filePath=paste0(evex,basename(rawdirs[1]),'_GPS.csv',sep=''))  EVSaveAsFile(EVFile,paste0(paste0(evex,"Montague_",basename(rawdirs[1]),'.EV',sep='')))  #Quit Echoview QuitEchoview(EVApp)

title: Control of Echoview via COM
text: Currently, EchoviewR quite dependencies, something hoping rectify. Meanwhile, need install following R packages: sp,geosphere,maptools,RDCOMClient lubridate can install packages following R code: {r dependPacks,eval=FALSE} install.packages(c('sp','geosphere','maptools','RDCOMClient','lubridate')) RDCOMClient fails Echoview crashing frequently exprected using EchoviewR (likely behaviour R > v4.x): Please install RDCOMClient (see details):{r dependPacks, eval=FALSE} install.packages("RDCOMClient", repos = "http://www.omegahat.net/R", type = "win.binary") {r dependPacks, eval=FALSE} devtools::install_github("omegahat/RDCOMClient") older versions R recommended install RDCOMClient (see details): {r altRDCOMClient, eval=FALSE} devtools::install_github("dkyleward/RDCOMClient") expected CRAN version issues RDCOMClient fixed near future. install still fails Rtools go [https://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/Rtools/] install latest version Rtools. Rtools installed, restart RStudio install RDCOMClient proceeding install EchoviewR. ready install EchoviewR package directly github using devtools (Wickham & Chang, 2016): {r install,eval=FALSE} (!requireNamespace("devtools",quietly=TRUE)) install.packages("devtools") # Latest devtools syntax devtools::install_github("AustralianAntarcticDivision/EchoviewR", build_opts = c("---resave-data", "---manual")) ## devtools v < 2.0 # devtools::install_github("AustralianAntarcticDivision/EchoviewR", build_vignettes = TRUE, force_deps=TRUE) NB like older EchoviewR version (v1.0) used 2017 meeting CCAMLR Subgroup Acoustics, Survey Analysis Methods, please use following code: {r installASAM,eval=FALSE} devtools::install_github('AustralianAntarcticDivision/EchoviewR',ref='v1.0') ready work EchoviewR: {r startEVR, eval=FALSE} library(EchoviewR)

code: EVFishTracking(   EVFile,   EVVar,   FishTrackRegionClass = "Unclassified regions",   export = NULL,   DataDimensions = NULL,   Alpha.MajorAxis = NULL,   Alpha.MinorAxis = NULL,   Alpha.Range = NULL,   Beta.MajorAxis = NULL,   Beta.MinorAxis = NULL,   Beta.Range = NULL,   ExclusionDistance.MajorAxis = NULL,   ExclusionDistance.MinorAxis = NULL,   ExclusionDistance.Range = NULL,   MissedPingExpansion.MajorAxis = NULL,   MissedPingExpansion.MinorAxis = NULL,   MissedPingExpansion.Range = NULL,   Weights.MajorAxis = NULL,   Weights.MinorAxis = NULL,   Weights.Range = NULL,   Weights.TS = NULL,   Weights.PingGap = NULL,   MinimumTargets = NULL,   MinimumPings = NULL,   MaximumGap = NULL )

title: Detect Fish Tracks — EVFishTracking
text: EVFile Echoview file COM object EVVar Echoview single target variable character string FishTrackRegionClass string indicating region class name fish tracks assigned export full file path text string export file (.e. "C:/FishTracking/Exports/FishTracks.csv"). NULL value skips export fish tracks. DataDimensions numeric Determine algorithim used fish tracks. Accepted values 2 (single dual beam) 4 (split beam) Alpha.MajorAxis numeric Increases Alpha gain setting Major Axis Alpha.MinorAxis numeric Increases Alpha gain setting Minor Axis Alpha.Range numeric Increases Alpha gain setting Range Beta.MajorAxis numeric Increases Beta gain setting Major Axis Beta.MinorAxis numeric Increases Beta gain setting Minor Axis Beta.Range numeric Increases Beta gain setting Range ExclusionDistance.MajorAxis numeric Increases distance value major axis target gate parameters ExclusionDistance.MinorAxis numeric Increases distance value minor axis target gate parameters ExclusionDistance.Range numeric Increases distance value range target gate parameters MissedPingExpansion.MajorAxis numeric Increases expansion value major axis target gate parameters MissedPingExpansion.MinorAxis numeric Increases expansion value ofminor axis target gate parameters MissedPingExpansion.Range numeric Increases expansion value missed pings range target gate parameters. 0 disables missed ping expansion Weights.MajorAxis numeric 1-100 Assigns weighting major axis Weights.MinorAxis numeric 1-100 Assigns weighting minor axis Weights.Range numeric 1-100 Assigns weighting range Weights.TS numeric 1-100 Assigns weighting target strength Weights.PingGap numeric 1-100 MinimumTargets numeric Minimum number single targets considered fish track MinimumPings numeric Maximum number pings track MaximumGap numeric Maximum ping gap tracks

title: Detect Fish Tracks — EVFishTracking
text: http://support.echoview.com/WebHelp/Echoview.htm/

code: if (FALSE) { EVAppObj <- COMCreate('EchoviewCom.EvApplication') EVFile <- EVOpenFile(EVAppObj,'~~/KAOS/KAOStemplate.EV')$EVFile EVFishTracking(EVFile = EvFile, EVVar = "Single target detection - wideband 1", FishTrackRegionClass = "FishTracks", MinimumTargets = 5, export = "C:/FishTracking/Exports/FishTracks.csv") }

title: Estimate mean and variance across multiple strata using the Jolly and Hampton (1990) method — jhMultipleStrataF
code: if (FALSE) { svy1=jhF(transectLength=tLengths, transectMeanDen=denV, transectName=NULL,svyName='test',area=svyA) svy2=jhF(transectLength=tLengths, transectMeanDen=denV, transectName=NULL,svyName='test',area=svyA)  jhMultipleStrataF(strata=list(svy1,svy2))  svy3=jhF(transectLength=tLengths, transectMeanDen=denV, transectName=NULL,svyName='test',area=svyA*2)  jhMultipleStrataF(strata=list(svy1,svy3))  svy4=jhF(transectLength=tLengths, transectMeanDen=denV*2, transectName=NULL,svyName='test',area=svyA)  jhMultipleStrataF(strata=list(svy1,svy4))  }

title: Generate a coordinate list for a zig-zag survey — zigzagSurvey
code: if (FALSE) { coords=zigzagSurvey(startLon=-100,startLat=-60,lineLengthkm=2, startBearingdeg=30, rotationdeg=10,numOfLines=11) plot(0,0,xlim=range(coords[,1]),ylim=range(coords[,2]),type='n', xlab='Longitude, deg',ylab='Latitude, deg') arrows(x0=coords[1:(nrow(coords)-1),1], y0=coords[1:(nrow(coords)-1),2],        x1 = coords[2:nrow(coords),1], y1 = coords[2:nrow(coords),2]) text(coords,row.names(coords),cex=0.6) points(coords[1,1],coords[1,2],col='blue',pch=17,cex=2) points(coords[nrow(coords),1],coords[nrow(coords),2],col='blue',pch=15,cex=2) legend('topright',c('Beginning','End'),col='blue',pch=c(17,15)) #Use unrotated=TRUE and check coordinates in the-  #-returned coordinate list object are identical: coordL= zigzagSurvey(startLon=-100,startLat=-60,lineLengthkm=2, startBearingdeg=30, rotationdeg=0,numOfLines=11,unrotated=TRUE) identical(coordL[[1]],coordL[[2]]) #display rotated and unrotated coordinates" coordL= zigzagSurvey(startLon=-100,startLat=-60,lineLengthkm=2, startBearingdeg=30, rotationdeg=5,numOfLines=11,unrotated=TRUE)  coords=coordL$unrotatedGeogs; coordsRotate=coordL$rotatedGeogs plot(0,0,xlim=range(c(coords[,1],coordsRotate[,1])), ylim=range(c(coords[,2],coordsRotate[,2])),type='n', xlab='Longitude, deg',ylab='Latitude, deg') arrows(x0=coords[1:(nrow(coords)-1),1], y0=coords[1:(nrow(coords)-1),2],        x1 = coords[2:nrow(coords),1], y1 = coords[2:nrow(coords),2]) arrows(x0=coordsRotate[1:(nrow(coordsRotate)-1),1],  y0=coordsRotate[1:(nrow(coordsRotate)-1),2],        x1 = coordsRotate[2:nrow(coordsRotate),1],        y1 = coordsRotate[2:nrow(coordsRotate),2],col='blue') legend('bottomleft',c('Unrotated','Rotated'),lty=1,col=c(1,'blue')) }
